10:33 <tassoman> Hello there :)  
10:34 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <tassoman> how can I "explode" login/register links inside the horizontal bar and the search box? I want to remove the ribs/sausages menu  
10:36 <cjd> Oh you mean the hamburger menu?  
10:37 <cjd> https://www.google.com/search?q=hamburger+icon  
10:37 <cjd> that?  
10:38 <tassoman> yup it is!  
10:39 <cjd> :D  
10:39 <cjd> Maybe we all should go for lunch  
10:39 <tassoman> I'd like to obtain the same horizontal sections as xwiki.org website  
10:39 <tassoman> then the menu application I've already configured  
10:39 <cjd> Perhaps try searching for the "UX Extension" api  
10:40 <cjd> there should be a way to register an extension and in that extension, put the link to login/register  
10:40 <cjd> I gather you want the link to be visible all of the time so the user does not need to click the hamburger (or ribs)  
10:41 <tassoman> Yes, cjd you got it!  
10:41 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <cjd> Yeah, I would say to google:  "xwiki ui extension" and then see if there is an extension point which puts a link in the part of the UI where you want it  
10:44 <tassoman> Do you know ui name for the horizontal logo + search button bar?  
10:44 <tassoman> I've landed on the XWiki/UIExtensionClass page  
10:45 <cjd> hmmm not really  
10:48 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
10:49 <tassoman> cjd: maybe you meant "UIExtension Module" ?  
10:51 <cjd> yes  
10:52 <Trefex> has quit  
10:53 <cjd> It might be that there is no extension point where you want, in which case you'll have to modify the velocity macros which are on the filesystem  
10:53 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
10:54 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <tassoman> An extensionpoint is somehow an hook to append custom behaviours?  
10:56 <cjd> yup  
10:57 <cjd> you can modify a velocity template on the fs but that will make it harder to upgrade xwiki later
